addressleaf.section:
To
e right honorable my very singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England

28 Julij 1594 M
r
Bodley to my Lo. From the Haghe./
e dowt made, because of a c
o
term
a
d to
Car
o
e xv of July
assur
a
ce
t
the
stat
will fournish
e shipp
y
g re
q
red

page.lettertext:
fol.63r
May it please yo
r
good L. I reported in my last
e 21
of this moneth
e answear of
e states to her
Ma
ties
demaund,
for their assistance by sea: whereto I finde them by their
speeches very thoroughly disposed, and I doubt not all
of their speedy perfourmance. They doe attend altoge-
ther upon her Hig
es
precise and final resolution, w
t
out
the w
ch
they will not make any present preparation for
the reasons alleaged in my former to yo
r
L. and because
they sawe
at those demaundes, w
ch
were delivered M
r
Caron
e 15 of this moneth
, were then
e self same day coun-
termaunded againe: whereby remaining uncertaine of
her Ma
ties
intention, they knowe not howe to frame
e course
of their provision. Nevertheles I doe alwaies assure
them,
at they shall have notice of it, assoone as is needefull.
I am also earnest w
t
them, not onely to doe
at, w
ch
was
required of M
r
Caron, by those forsaid demaundes, but to
extend
e particulars to some greater proportion, w
ch
I
am
certainly persuaded, they will accomplishe in good
sort, to her Hig
es
contentation. Moreover I sup-
pose,
at sith they have determined, as I am informed,
at
e newe Englishe bandes being in their pay, shalbe
reduced to 8 enseignes, w
ch
were 13 at
e first, they
may be likewise induced by her Ma
ties
intreatie, to send
them all towardes
Brest,
and to continue them there in
e pay of these contreis, for
e
time of
e enterprise. W
ch
I
signifie to yo
r
L. as my privat persuasion, not omit-
ting any meanes
at I can use in
at regard, or in any
other w
at
soever, for
e advancem
t
of
at service.
And so
I take my humble leave. From
e Hage July 28
Yo
r
L. most humble at commaundem
t
. Tho. Bodley
